title: Cannot install libpciaccess from binary cache
body:
Build libpciaccess binary cache
garvct@service2/hpc-common/software/spack/0.11.2/spack/var/spack/mirror> spack buildcache create -f -k 81F2F332 libpciaccess@0.13.5%gcc@5.5.0
==> adding matching spec libpciaccess@0.13.5%gcc@5.5.0 arch=linux-sles11-x86_64 
==> recursing dependencies
==> adding dependency libpciaccess@0.13.5%gcc@5.5.0 arch=linux-sles11-x86_64 
==> creating binary cache file for package libpciaccess@0.13.5%gcc@5.5.0 arch=linux-sles11-x86_64  

> spack uninstall libpciaccess%gcc@5.5.0
==> The following packages will be uninstalled:

-- linux-sles11-x86_64 / gcc@5.5.0 ------------------------------
u2yfqy7 libpciaccess@0.13.5%gcc

Attempt to install libpciaccess using binary cache.

  File "/hpc-common/software/spack/0.11.2/spack/lib/spack/spack/package.py", line 1370, in do_install
    if self.try_install_from_binary_cache(explicit):
  File "/hpc-common/software/spack/0.11.2/spack/lib/spack/spack/package.py", line 1282, in try_install_from_binary_cache
    binary_spec, tarball, yes_to_all=False, force=False)
  File "/hpc-common/software/spack/0.11.2/spack/lib/spack/spack/binary_distribution.py", line 405, in extract_tarball
    raise NoVerifyException()
spack.binary_distribution.NoVerifyException

I can do a binary cache install for other packages, why does the binary cache install for libpciaccess fail?

I am using spack 0.11.2, running on SLES11SP4.

Thanks,
